availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry W. Cooksey (Caldwell County, Kentucky, stonecutter)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, stonecutter. Tennessee native. Married to Mildred W. Stephens Cooksey. Father of Rebecca A. Cooksey, Thomas Cooksey, Margaret A. Cooksey, Mary L. Cooksey, Henry W. Cooksey, and Elvira C. Cooksey. Employed by Joel H. Haydon as a stonecutter in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Stonecutter in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 397A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 41.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 506A.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, 157, p. 422C.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll#994029, Caldwell County Births, 1858, p. 2.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll#7020683, Caldwell County Deaths, p. 578.
Find A Grave, "Henry W Cooksey (1823-1893)," Memorial #195830185, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/195830185 (accessed April 7, 2021).
